title: How to Make a Chocolate Banana Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: Prepare the cake pans. Grease or line two 9-inch cake pans and dust with cocoa powder.

steps.headline: Sift the flour, cocoa, salt, baking powder and baking soda into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Set aside.

steps.headline: Cream the butter, sugar and vanilla extract.
steps.description: Combine until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the eggs.
steps.description: Add them in one at time, beating after each one.

steps.headline: Mash the bananas if not already done.
steps.description: Mix with the vegetable oil, lemon juice and milk. Add to the remaining wet ingredients.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients in with the soured milk alternatively, in three lots.
Transfer half of the batter into one prepared pan, the other half into the other pan.
steps.description: Place in the oven and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake returns clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Let sit in the pan for a few minutes, then turn out onto a wire cool rack to cool completely.

steps.headline: Ice the cake when it has cooled.
steps.description: Either chocolate or banana icing is fine.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350F/180ºC.
steps.description: Prepare the cake pans by greasing and lightly flouring or by lining with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Sift the flour, baking soda and salt into the mixing bowl.
Cream the sugars and butter together.
Add the eggs in, one at a time.
steps.description: Mix to combine, then stir in the mashed bananas.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients and the buttermilk alternately, in 3 even lots.
steps.description: Stir in.

steps.headline: Fold in the chocolate chips and walnuts.
steps.description: Transfer the batter into the prepared cake pans.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake returns clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Let sit in the pan for a few minutes, then turn out onto a wire cool rack to cool completely.

steps.headline: Ice the cake when it has cooled completely.
steps.description: Either chocolate or banana icing is fine.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: Prepare the cake pan or baking dish by spraying with non-stick cooking spray or lining with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Mash the bananas in a bowl.
steps.description: Use a fork or a vegetable masher.

steps.headline: Add the sugars, applesauce, water and vinegar.
steps.description: Stir through to combine.

steps.headline: Sift in the flour, cocoa and baking soda.
steps.description: Add the salt. Stir only enough to combine.

steps.headline: Fold in one third cup of chocolate chips.
Transfer the batter to the cake pan or baking dish.
steps.description: Sprinkle the remaining chocolate chips over the top of the batter.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the cake comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Let sit in the pan for a few minutes, then turn out onto a wire cool rack to cool completely.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: There is no need to ice this cake; the chocolate chips on the top already serve as a delicious topping.

text: Chocolate banana cake Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the cake pans. Grease or line two 9-inch cake pans and dust with cocoa powder. Sift the flour, cocoa, salt, baking powder and baking soda into a mixing bowl. Set aside. Cream the butter, sugar and vanilla extract. Combine until light and fluffy. Add the eggs. Add them in one at time, beating after each one. Mash the bananas if not already done. Mix with the vegetable oil, lemon juice and milk. Add to the remaining wet ingredients. Mix the dry ingredients in with the soured milk alternatively, in three lots.  Transfer half of the batter into one prepared pan, the other half into the other pan. Place in the oven and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake returns clean. Remove from the oven. Let sit in the pan for a few minutes, then turn out onto a wire cool rack to cool completely. Ice the cake when it has cooled. Either chocolate or banana icing is fine. Chocolate chip cake Preheat the oven to 350F/180ºC. Prepare the cake pans by greasing and lightly flouring or by lining with parchment paper. Sift the flour, baking soda and salt into the mixing bowl.  Cream the sugars and butter together.  Add the eggs in, one at a time. Mix to combine, then stir in the mashed bananas. Add the dry ingredients and the buttermilk alternately, in 3 even lots. Stir in. Fold in the chocolate chips and walnuts. Transfer the batter into the prepared cake pans. Place in the oven. Bake for 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake returns clean. Remove from the oven. Let sit in the pan for a few minutes, then turn out onto a wire cool rack to cool completely. Ice the cake when it has cooled completely. Either chocolate or banana icing is fine. Chocolate banana applesauce cake Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the cake pan or baking dish by spraying with non-stick cooking spray or lining with parchment paper. Mash the bananas in a bowl. Use a fork or a vegetable masher. Add the sugars, applesauce, water and vinegar. Stir through to combine. Sift in the flour, cocoa and baking soda. Add the salt. Stir only enough to combine. Fold in one third cup of chocolate chips.  Transfer the batter to the cake pan or baking dish. Sprinkle the remaining chocolate chips over the top of the batter. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the cake comes out clean. Remove from the oven. Let sit in the pan for a few minutes, then turn out onto a wire cool rack to cool completely. Serve. There is no need to ice this cake; the chocolate chips on the top already serve as a delicious topping.
